intro: Myrmeconauclea strigosa, commonly known as the hairy myrmeconae, is a shrub native to the tropical regions of South America. It belongs to the family Euphorbiaceae, which includes a wide variety of plants with diverse morphological characteristics. The plant is distinguished by its hairy stems and leaves, which are covered in fine, soft pubescence. Its flowers are small and clustered, typically greenish-yellow in color, and it produces capsule fruits that contain numerous seeds. Myrmeconauclea strigosa is often found in moist, shaded environments such as forests and undergrowth.
